result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juwan Daquan Fifer

records.addlTxt: /filed.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Juwan Daquan Fifer.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-06-2022, filed.
/filed.
/filed.
/filed.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Juwan Daquan Fifer.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference. Defendant has completed TAD evaluation and qualifies for drug treatment court. Defense requests DPA hearing be scheduled. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-24-2022, filed.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant appears via zoom. Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Settlement negotiations pending.   Defendant advised to appear in person for next Court date.

Matter adjourned to Br. 9 for continued Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-08-2022, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court, appear by video with attorney Jason A Findling, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-13-2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Court reminded the defendant to continue working with Justice Point.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-02-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-02-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Juwan Daquan Fifer in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
